DOC.brief_summary: The objective of this study is to compare the safety and efficacy of BRM421 Ophthalmic Solution to placebo for the treatment of the signs and symptoms of dry eye.
DOC.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of BRM421 for Dry Eye Syndrome
DOC.criteria: Be at least 18 years of age; Provide written informed consent; Have a reported history of dry eye for at least 6 months prior to enrollment; Have a history of use of eye drops Have any clinically significant slit lamp findings at Visit 1 that may include active blepharitis, meibomian gland dysfunction (MGD), lid margin inflammation or active ocular allergies that require therapeutic treatment, and/or in the opinion of the investigator may interfere with study parameters; Be diagnosed with an ongoing ocular infection (bacterial, viral, or fungal), or active ocular inflammation at Visit 1; Have worn contact lenses within 7 days of Visit 1 or anticipate using contact lenses during the study; Have used any eye drops within 2 hours of Visit 1; Have previously had laserassisted in situ keratomileusis (LASIK) surgery within the last 12 months; Be a woman of childbearing potential who is not using an acceptable means of birth control; acceptable methods of contraception
